subject: Marketing
title: The Power of Surprise
description: A quick win: understand The Power of Surprise.

hook.text: Burger King told customers to order from McDonald's. It broke the internet.

buildup.text: Surprise jolts the brain. It forces attention and creates a memory that sticks.

discovery.text: Pattern interruption is the mechanism. When expectations break, the brain pays attention.

twist.text: Surprise without relevance is just confusion. The shock must connect to the brand.

climax.text: Burger King's stunt worked because it was surprising, generous, and on-brand.

punchline.text: Break the pattern, then own the moment.

quiz.question: Why did Burger King's campaign telling customers to visit McDonald's work?
options: It was surprising, generous, and tied to the brand's identity
McDonald's paid Burger King for the promotion
